entry.title: PyID
entry.content: An automated tool to identify type inconsistencies between source code and method docstrings in Python across popular Python libraries.

entry.title: Improv
entry.content: An automated evaluation framework to assess the reviewability of pull requests, that is modularized using container-based virtualization.

entry.title: Propr
entry.content: A webhook based developer feedback and report generation tool for the identification of factors associated with the reviewability of pull requests.

entry.title: Dense-Net
entry.content: A feed-forward Neural Network library using computational gate approach supporting multiple optimizers, common activation and loss functions

entry.title: Propr - Assess pull request reviewability
entry.content: Why did I developer Propr, and how can it help developers improve their pull requests?

entry.title: Mailing List Network Analyzer
entry.content: An analysis framework for decoding the structure of developer mailing lists, using community detection and text mining to identify topic experts and label communities.

entry.title: FCM Feature Selection
entry.content: A novel feature selection technique using cosine similarity scores on the semantic centroids calculated from the normalized term-term correlation factors based on Fuzzy C-Means clustering.

entry.title: Fitness-aware Container Brokering
entry.content: An integration agent that benchmarks and containerizes a SaaS catalog offering and a smart fulfillment engine that deploys it into the best-fit container out of a set of containers hosted on various underlying clouds.

entry.title: ASL Translation
entry.content: An ensemble classifier for translation of American Sign Language gestures with hard negative mining and non-maximal suppression for localization, using histogram of gradients and local binary patterns as features.

entry.title: Legislative Trends using NLP
entry.content: Identification of latent structures within Indian parliamentary debates using natural language processing to discover seasonal trends in the debates of the upper and lower houses.
